job description:
Amgen is a biopharmaceutical leader founded on discovering, developing, manufacturing, and delivering innovative human therapeutics. Amgen's Discovery Technologies laboratory within Therapeutic Discovery is seeking a highly motivated high throughput mass spectrometry Scientist at Amgen headquarters in Thousand Oaks.

The successful candidate will be responsible primarily for the development of Affinity Selection Mass Spectrometry methods for screening and characterizing small molecule ligands of protein targets as part of an integrated drug discovery effort. Additional responsibilities may include the development and execution of mass spectrometric-based enzyme assays or the characterization of protein-small molecule adducts as part of our efforts toward the discovery of new drugs.

The successful candidate will work closely with biology and chemistry teams to develop new assays and strategies, analyze results, and present and discuss high quality data in a timely manner and should also contribute to skills development and mentoring for colleagues in a highly multi-disciplinary environment.
  • *Basic Qualifications**
Doctoral degree

OR

Master's degree and 4 years of scientific experience

OR

Bachelor's degree and 6 years of scientific experience
  • *Preferred Qualifications**
Doctoral degree and 2 years of mass spectrometry experience

Deep knowledge of MS techniques especially as applied to Affinity Selection MS or to the high-throughput analysis of protein-small molecule interactions

Experience with the operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of Q-TOF, QQQ, and/or MALDI mass spectrometers, including the use of LC, SPE, or SEC separation techniques. Familiarity with Agilent, SCIEX, and Bruker instrumentation and software e.g. Agilent MassHunter and SCIEX MultiQuant software is desirable

Experience in the development of LC-MS, LC-MS/MS, or SPE-MS methods for the development of affinity selection-based MS assays, MS-based enzyme assays, or to characterize of protein-small molecule adducts

Familiarity with the principles of high-throughput screening (HTS) and experience with microplate readers and automated liquid handling systems for HTS

Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a member of a multidisciplinary team

Excellent written and oral communication skills for the timely documentation, presentation, and discussion of science-based results and strategy in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary, team-based environment

Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people's lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world's leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential.
